column4: Hi, I am making a home file server with ubuntu 10.04 and after the reboot after installation, I am stuck at the grub command line. Any ideas?
Do you get any error message at boot?
no i don't, i typed 'boot' and and it says 'no loaded kernel'
And this is immediately after a normal install?
'error: no loaded kernal" i meant
yes.
Do you have more than one hard drive?
no i don't, but when i typed ls. it listed '(hd0) and (hd0,1)
is that normal for having only one hd?
Yes.
What is the output of "source /boot/grub/grub.cfg"?
nothing comes up
If you press escape do you see a menu?
just shows grub> _
no i dont, i just skips to the next line
Could you boot a liveCD and run boot info script as explained here: http://ubuntuforums.org/showthread.php?t=1291280 and pastebin the RESULTS.txt?
let me try that. I will let you knwo what happens
Here it is: http://pastebin.com/EM0j4C8X
let me know what you think.
I'm not sure what exactly is happening. Could you ask in #grub, including a link to that boot info script in your qestion?
no prob. thanks. will do
Also, please run "cat /boot/grub/grub.cfg" at the grub prompt and confirm that there are no errors and it seems to match the contents of your grub.cfg?
